content: During the third quarter, earnings per share increased 140% over the prior year to $0.60 per diluted share driven by accelerating retail sales momentum, triple-digit year-over-year e-commerce growth, and favorable credit performance. From a channel perspective, we ended the quarter with a record $19.2 million of e-commerce sales with 294.8% year-over-year increase in e-commerce sales as a result of the investments we have been making to improve the functionality of our website and create a frictionless customer experience online, while also leveraging our best-in-class next day, white glove delivery capabilities. In fact, cash, credit card and third-party finance sales have increased 23.9% during the third quarter after increasing 32.7% in the third quarter last fiscal year. On a consolidated basis, total revenues were $405.5 million for the third quarter, representing a 21.4% increase from the same period last fiscal year. Looking at our retail segment in more detail, total retail revenues for the third quarter were $334.8 million, a 28.8% increase from the same period last fiscal year. Retail gross margin for the third quarter was 36.8%, a decrease of 150 basis points from the same period last fiscal year. As a percent of retail sales, SG&A expenses were 30.2% for the third quarter compared to 32.4% for the same period last fiscal year. Retail segment operating income was $22.5 million compared to $15.2 million for the same period last fiscal year due to higher retail sales and improved operating leverage, partially offset by lower retail gross margin.
